result.execSummary:
The defendant Corey J. Hayes was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property >$10,000, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: *Court has no objection to having probation transferred to the State of Colorado. Court allows for travel permits to Colorado during term of probation.

miscConds.notes: *Restitution set at $199,277.18  payable to Supplement Warehouse/Bankruptcy receiver Michael Polsky, to be collected during term of probation; $10,000.00 payable to Acuity Insurance Company, joint/several with Orlando Washington, 15CF1296. If defendant is revoked, restitution to be collected by DOC from the defendant's wages and from other monies held in the defendant's inmate account; an amount or a percentage which the department determines is reasonable for restitution to victims; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.

*Court WAIVED Court costs and all applicable assessments as defendant has a large amount of restitution to be paid.
*Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge, to be collected during term of probation. If defendant is revoked, all related surcharges are to be collected by DOC up to 25%  from the defendant's funds held in the defendant's inmate account; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment.
*Pay all supervision fees.

*Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored. Court further advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.

*No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
*No contact with Robert L., Kelly K., Supplement Warehouse management team, Corey Hayes, Aaron M., Matthew M.
*No illegal drugs.
*No use of prescription medications without a valid prescription.

*Cooperate with agent.
*Cooperate with any correctional programs recommended.
*Follow all rules of probation and extended supervision.

*AODA assessment and any recommended treatment.
*Random urine screens if department deems necessary.

timeConds.notes:
08-23-2017/ Judge Dennis Cimpl       
The Court granted the defendant's request for release privileges as follows:
WORK - 14 hours per day - 2 days per week;
TREATMENT - medical

*With Huber release privileges for work. No good time credit. Court does not object to electronic monitoring. Defendant to report to the House of Corrections on June 27, 2017 by 5:00 p.m. Court allows for a 48 hour pass to allow for the defendant to attend the birth of his child in August, via c-section. Defendant to provide documentation with the date and name of hospital.

records.addlTxt: reflects 08-23-17 court order for add'l release privileges
Order (for Release Privledges; Granted), signed and filed.
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Dennis R. Cimpl, Br. 19, for review. spc
Letter seeking sentence modification written by Corey Hayes received and filed 08-22-2017

Defendant Corey J. Hayes in court with attorney Jonathan A. LaVoy.  Joshua Miles Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made by the State, Defense and Defendant.  The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 6 YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 3 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 3 YEARS.  Court STAYED sentence and placed the defendant on PROBATION for a period of 5 YEARS with the following conditions for probation and extended supervision:
Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.  
-Restitution set at $199,277.18  payable to Supplement Warehouse/Bankruptcy receiver Michael Polsky, to be collected during term of probation; $10,000.00 payable to Acuity Insurance Company, joint/several with Orlando Washington, 15CF1296.  If defendant is revoked, restitution to be collected by DOC from the defendant's wages and from other monies held in the defendant's inmate account; an amount or a percentage which the department determines is reasonable for restitution to victims; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment 
-Court WAIVED Court costs and all applicable assessments as defendant has a large amount of restitution to be paid 
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge, to be collected during term of probation. If defendant is revoked, all related surcharges are to be collected by DOC up to 25%  from the defendant's funds held in the defendant's inmate account; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment
-No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
-Cooperate with agent
-Cooperate with any correctional programs recommended
-Follow all rules of probation and extended supervision
-Pay all supervision fees 
-Obtain/maintain full-time employment 
-No contact with Robert L., Kelly K., Supplement Warehouse management team, Corey Hayes, Aaron M., Matthew M., 
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Random urine screens if department deems necessary 
-No illegal drugs 
-No use of prescription medications without a valid prescription
-Court has no objection to having probation transferred to the State of Colorado
-Court allows for travel permits to Colorado during term of probation
-As a condition of probation, Court ordered defendant serve 9 MONTHS in the House of Corrections, with Huber release privileges for work.  No good time credit.  Court does not object to electronic monitoring.  Defendant to report to the House of Corrections on June 27, 2017 by 5:00 p.m.   Court allows for a 48 hour pass to allow for the defendant to attend the birth of his child in August, via c-section.  Defendant to provide documentation with the date and name of hospital.  

Filed, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Filed, Sentencing Referral Form
Character reference letters

Defendant Corey J. Hayes in court with attorney Benjamin Lutgen for Jonathan LaVoy.  Joshua Miles Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney LaVoy unavailable; adjournment requested.  Matter reset for Sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 26, 2017 at 08:30 am.
From ADA Joshua Mathy dated April 25, 2017 with attached exhibits for sentencing.
For Adjournment received and filed.

Defendant Corey J. Hayes in court with attorney Jonathan A. LaVoy.  Joshua Miles Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Status conference conducted.  Parties request matter be scheduled for Sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 27, 2017 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Corey J. Hayes in court with attorney Jonathan A. LaVoy.  Joshua Miles Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant changes plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.  Court further advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Matter scheduled for Status.  Status conference scheduled for February 7, 2017 at 08:30 am.

Received and filed

Defendant Corey J. Hayes in court with attorney Jonathan A. LaVoy.  Joshua Miles Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Original Amended Information received and filed.  Defense acknowledges receipt of the Amended Information, waives reading and enters a plea of not guilty subject to party to a crime objection on behalf of his client.  Party to a Crime added to Counts 1 and 2, pursuant to Wisc. Stats. Sec. 939.05.  Final pre-trial scheduled for January 31, 2017 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Corey J. Hayes in court with attorney Jonathan A. LaVoy.  Joshua Miles Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Final pretrial conducted.  Discussions held in chambers.  Parties request an additional final pretrial  Final pre-trial scheduled for January 31, 2017 at 08:30 am.

Defendant's Joint Motion for Issuance of Certificate to Extradite Out-of-State Witness, Affidavits from Attorney LaVoy and Attorney Powell in support, proposed Findings, a Proposed Certificate and a Proposed Certificate of Clerk received and filed.

Defendant Corey J. Hayes in court with attorney Jonathan A. Lavoy.  Joshua Miles Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Discussions held in chambers off the record. Final pre-trial scheduled for January 19, 2017 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for February 6, 2017 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Corey J. Hayes in court with attorney Jonathan A. Lavoy.  David A. Feiss appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Brett Mendola-Oak Creek Police Department Detective. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Case is adjourned to Branch 22.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.
